archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Lime-Herb Chicken Cabbage Salad with Jasmine Rice
description: Bright, crunchy chicken-and-cabbage salad with apple, herbs, and a light lime-vinegar dressing, served alongside fluffy jasmine rice. Fresh Vietnamese/Japanese-inspired flavors with no soy.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Roughly chop a small handful each of mint, basil, and coriander.
In a small bowl, whisk juice of 1.5 limes, 2 tbsp rice vinegar, and 1 tsp honey until dissolved; season with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Pat dry 600 g chicken thighs and season both sides with salt and black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 3 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer 12–15 minutes until tender; rest covered 5 minutes.
Sear chicken: Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add chicken thighs and cook 5–6 minutes per side until cooked through. Transfer to a board to rest 3 minutes, then slice.
Assemble salad: In a large bowl, combine cabbage, carrots, apple, and chopped herbs. Drizzle over the lime-vinegar dressing and toss to coat. Taste and adjust salt and black pepper.
Serve: Fluff rice and portion into bowls. Add a generous mound of the cabbage salad and top with sliced chicken. Squeeze the remaining 1/2 lime over portions to taste.
Optional: If rice is cooked early, briefly microwave portions 20–30 seconds to rewarm before serving.
